intro: Heyderia formosana, commonly known as the Taiwan hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth surface with a slightly waxy texture. Heyderia formosana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
